MultiLens.Profiles package¶

Submodules¶

MultiLens.Profiles.SIS module¶

class MultiLens.Profiles.SIS.SIS[source]¶

Bases: object

this class contains the function and the derivatives of the Singular Isothermal Sphere in Physical coordinates

all(x, y, phi_E_sis, center_x_sis=0, center_y_sis=0)[source]¶

returns f,f_x,f_y,f_xx, f_yy, f_xy

derivatives(x, y, phi_E_sis, center_x_sis=0, center_y_sis=0)[source]¶

returns df/dx and df/dy of the function

function(x, y, phi_E_sis, center_x_sis=0, center_y_sis=0)[source]¶
hessian(x, y, phi_E_sis, center_x_sis=0, center_y_sis=0)[source]¶

returns Hessian matrix of function d^2f/dx^2, d^f/dy^2, d^2/dxdy

MultiLens.Profiles.gaussian module¶

class MultiLens.Profiles.gaussian.Gaussian[source]¶

Bases: object

this class contains functions to evaluate a Gaussian function and calculates its derivative and hessian matrix

returns Gaussian

hessian(x, y, amp, sigma_x, sigma_y, center_x=0, center_y=0)[source]¶

returns Hessian matrix of function d^2f/dx^2, d^f/dy^2, d^2/dxdy

MultiLens.Profiles.nfw module¶

class MultiLens.Profiles.nfw.HaloParam[source]¶

Bases: object

class which contains a halo model parameters dependent on cosmology for NFW profile all distances are given in comoving coordinates

M200(Rs, rho0, c)[source]¶

M(R_200) calculation for NFW profile

Parameters:
  • Rs (float) – scale radius
  • rho0 (float) – density normalization (characteristic density)
  • c (float [4,40]) – consentration
Returns:

M(R_200) density
c_M_z(M, z)[source]¶

fitting function of http://moriond.in2p3.fr/J08/proceedings/duffy.pdf for the mass and redshift dependence of the concentration parameter

Parameters:
  • M (float or numpy array) – halo mass in M_sun/h
  • z (float >0) – redshift
Returns:

concentration parameter as float
profileMain(M, z)[source]¶

returns all needed parameter to draw the profile of the main halo

r200_M(M)[source]¶

computes the radius R_200 of a halo of mass M in comoving distances

Parameters:M (float or numpy array) – halo mass in M_sun/h
Returns:radius R_200 in comoving Mpc/h
rho0_c(c)[source]¶

computes density normalization as a functio of concentration parameter :return: density normalization in h^2/Mpc^3 (comoving)

rhoc = 277536627000.0¶
class MultiLens.Profiles.nfw.NFW[source]¶

Bases: object

this class contains functions concerning the NFW profile

relation are: R_200 = c * Rs

F(X)[source]¶

analytic solution of the projection integral

Parameters:x (float >0) – R/Rs
all(x, y, Rs, rho0, r200=100, center_x_nfw=0, center_y_nfw=0, angle=False)[source]¶

returns f,f_x,f_y,f_xx, f_yy, f_xy

alpha2rho0(phi_E, Rs)[source]¶

convert angle at Rs into rho0

derivatives(x, y, Rs, rho0, r200=100, center_x_nfw=0, center_y_nfw=0, angle=False)[source]¶

returns df/dx and df/dy of the function (integral of NFW)

function(x, y, Rs, rho0, r200=100, center_x_nfw=0, center_y_nfw=0, angle=False)[source]¶

returns double integral of NFW profile

g(X)[source]¶

analytic solution of integral for NFW profile to compute deflection angel and gamma

Parameters:x (float >0) – R/Rs
h(X)[source]¶

analytic solution of integral for NFW profile to compute the potential

Parameters:x (float >0) – R/Rs
hessian(x, y, Rs, rho0, r200=100, center_x_nfw=0, center_y_nfw=0, angle=False)[source]¶

returns Hessian matrix of function d^2f/dx^2, d^f/dy^2, d^2/dxdy

nfw2D(R, Rs, rho0, r200=1)[source]¶

projected two dimenstional NFW profile (kappa*Sigma_crit)

Parameters:
  • R (float/numpy array) – radius of interest
  • Rs (float) – scale radius
  • rho0 (float) – density normalization (characteristic density)
  • r200 (float>0) – radius of (sub)halo
Returns:

Epsilon(R) projected density at radius R
nfw2D_smoothed(R, Rs, rho0, r200, pixscale)[source]¶

projected two dimenstional NFW profile with smoothing around the pixel scale this routine is ment to better compare outputs to N-body simulations (not ment ot do lensemodelling with it)

Parameters:
  • R (float/numpy array) – radius of interest
  • Rs (float) – scale radius
  • rho0 (float) – density normalization (characteristic density)
  • r200 (float>0) – radius of (sub)halo
  • pixscale (float>0) – pixel scale (same units as R,Rs)
Returns:

Epsilon(R) projected density at radius R
nfw3D(R, Rs, rho0)[source]¶

three dimenstional NFW profile

Parameters:
  • R (float/numpy array) – radius of interest
  • Rs (float) – scale radius
  • rho0 (float) – density normalization (characteristic density)
Returns:

rho(R) density
nfwAlpha(R, Rs, rho0, r200, ax_x, ax_y)[source]¶

deflection angel of NFW profile (*Sigma_crit*D_OL) along the projection to coordinate “axis”

Parameters:
  • R (float/numpy array) – radius of interest
  • Rs (float) – scale radius
  • rho0 (float) – density normalization (characteristic density)
  • r200 (float>0) – radius of (sub)halo
  • axis (same as R) – projection to either x- or y-axis
Returns:

Epsilon(R) projected density at radius R
nfwGamma(R, Rs, rho0, r200, ax_x, ax_y)[source]¶

shear gamma of NFW profile (*Sigma_crit) along the projection to coordinate “axis”

Parameters:
  • R (float/numpy array) – radius of interest
  • Rs (float) – scale radius
  • rho0 (float) – density normalization (characteristic density)
  • r200 (float>0) – radius of (sub)halo
  • axis (same as R) – projection to either x- or y-axis
Returns:

Epsilon(R) projected density at radius R
nfwPot(R, Rs, rho0, r200=1)[source]¶

lensing potential of NFW profile (*Sigma_crit*D_OL**2)

Parameters:
  • R (float/numpy array) – radius of interest
  • Rs (float) – scale radius
  • rho0 (float) – density normalization (characteristic density)
  • r200 (float>0) – radius of (sub)halo
Returns:

Epsilon(R) projected density at radius R

class MultiLens.Profiles.point_mass.PointMass[source]¶

Bases: object

class to compute the physical deflection angle of a point mass

all(x, y, mass, pos_x=0, pos_y=0)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • x – x-coord (in physical Mpc)
  • y – y-coord (in physical Mpc)
  • mass – mass of the point mass (in M_sun)
Returns:

returns all (in radian)

  • y – y-coord (in physical Mpc)
  • mass – mass of the point mass (in M_sun)
Returns:

deflection angle (in radian)

  • y – y-coord (in physical Mpc)
  • mass – mass of the point mass (in M_sun)
Returns:
